com.google.wave.api
Class ProfileServlet

java.lang.Object
  javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
          com.google.wave.api.ProfileServlet
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig
public class ProfileServlet
extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet

Servlet that handles profile related requests from Google Wave. This servlet is registered at /_wave/robot/profile. By default, the servlet responds with a JSON string that describes the Robot: 

 {"profileUrl":"http:///_wave/robot/profile",
  "imageUrl":"http:///_wave/robot/profile.png",
  "name":""}
This servlet also provides a hook that subclasses can extend to resolve profile that is in the robot domain, for example, Twitter user in the case of a Twitter robot. This hook will be called if the request contains a "name" query parameter. For example, the call to http://<server hostname/_wave/robot/profile?user=foo returns: 
 {"profileUrl":"http://twitter.com/foo",
  "imageUrl":"http://",
  "name":""}

Author:
mprasetya@google.com (Marcel Prasetya)

getCustomProfile

public ParticipantProfile getCustomProfile(java.lang.String name)
Get custom profile based on the "name" query parameter. If the robot doesn't support custom profile, it can simply return null.

Returns:
Custom profile based on "name" query parameter, or null if this robot doesn't support custom profile.
